Let those on whom the virtuous-minded Muse</br>Ne'er breath'd a portion of her hallow'd fire,</br>The sordid paths of vice and folly choose,</br>And to mean subjects smite the tinkling wire.
If aught to me of that blest art is giv'n,</br>To wake to pleasing melody the string,</br>Be mine the task, in gratitude to Heav'n,</br>Of deeds, which Heav'n applausive marks, to sing.
O!  godlike skill!  important gift to man,</br>The dying speech to kindle — to restore—</br>Add length'ning years to life's contracted span,</br>Amaz'd we stand!  admire!  give thanks — adore.
Say, HAWES, whence did the bright idea rise?</br>Whence flow'd the great, the comprehensive thought?</br>Combining skill profound with judgment wise,</br>By patient practice to perfection brought?

Perchance, whilst sinking in the rav'nous stream</br>Some bloated corpse breath'd forth its finer part,</br>To thee, by Heaven sent, on Mercy's beam</br>It came, and with the blessing fill'd thy heart.
Yet what avails to seek from whence it flow'd,</br>Enough it is for Piety to scan,</br>With grateful heart, th' indigent hand of God</br>Reveal'd in kindness to his favour'd man.
Long may the tree, which thou hast planted, thrive;</br>O'er all the land its friendly branches shoot;</br>Soon to its rightful dignity arrive,</br>And deeper daily pierce its delving root!
The son of wealth, to save a worthless name,</br>In vain the lofty monument would raise,</br>In vain he strives to buy an unearn'd fame,</br>With costly sculpture and with venal lays.
The figur'd marble, faithless to its trust,</br>To Time's corrosive tooth shall fall a prey;</br>Shall sink slow mould'ring into common dust,</br>And by oblivion's streams be wash'd away.
But thou a more substantial fame shall prove</br>Than gaudy tombs or venal lays can give;</br>Built on the base of every good man's love,</br>Thy praise to time's remotest hour shall live.
And lo!  fair Virtue spreads her ample page,</br>Where stands, inscrib'd in characters of gold,</br>Each worthy's name, of ev'ry clime and age,</br>By sacred truth's unerring pen enroll'd.
There, where her HOWARD'S name so long has shone,</br>Pre-eminent in Charity's blest cause,</br>By equi-lustrous rays of glory known,</br>Pleas'd we behold the honour'd name of HAWES.</br>
